title: The Wicked and God's Mercy
shortSummary: Psalm 36 contrasts the nature of the wicked with the steadfast mercy and righteousness of God. David reflects on the inner corruption of the ungodly and praises God's unfailing love as a refuge and source of life for the faithful.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and servant of the LORD, expressing insight into human sinfulness and God's mercy.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Unspecified individuals characterized by sin, deceit, and pride, serving as a contrast to the righteous.

definitions.definition: Moral wrongdoing or sin; a violation of God's law.
God's steadfast, covenantal love and mercy toward His people.
God's reliability and truthfulness in keeping His promises.
A metaphor for God's protection and care over His people.

outline.heading: The Nature of the Wicked
outline.description: David describes the internal corruption of the wicked, highlighting their lack of fear of God, self-deception, deceitful speech, and deliberate planning of evil.

outline.heading: God’s Mercy and Faithfulness
outline.description: The psalmist praises God's mercy as vast as the heavens and His faithfulness reaching to the clouds, emphasizing God's righteousness and just judgments.

outline.heading: The Refuge of God’s Lovingkindness
outline.description: David celebrates God's lovingkindness as a shelter where people find trust and satisfaction, describing God as the fountain of life and light.

outline.heading: A Prayer for Protection and Justice
outline.description: The psalmist petitions God to continue His lovingkindness to the righteous, to guard him from pride and wickedness, and affirms that evildoers will ultimately fall and not rise.

application: Recognize the danger of a heart without reverence for God and guard against self-deception in your own life.
Trust in God's unfailing mercy and faithfulness as your refuge and source of spiritual nourishment.
Seek to live uprightly, relying on God's protection against pride and the schemes of the wicked.
Pray for God's continued lovingkindness and righteousness to sustain you in a corrupt world.

keyVerses.text: Thy mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the vastness and reliability of God's mercy and faithfulness, encouraging trust in His character.

keyVerses.text: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.
keyVerses.significance: It portrays God's lovingkindness as a protective refuge, inviting believers to find safety and trust in Him.

keyVerses.text: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms that true life and understanding come only from God’s presence and illumination.

keyVerses.text: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
keyVerses.significance: It assures believers of the ultimate downfall of the wicked, reinforcing confidence in God's justice.
